retriever.lib.cleanup module¶

class retriever.lib.cleanup.Cleanup(function=<function no_cleanup at 0x0000000005ECB0B8>, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class represents a custom cleanup function and a dictionary of arguments to be passed to that function.

retriever.lib.cleanup.correct_invalid_value(value, args)[source]¶

This cleanup function replaces null indicators with None.

retriever.lib.cleanup.no_cleanup(value, args)[source]¶

Default cleanup function, returns the unchanged value.

A function to begin dataset downloads in a separate thread.

retriever.lib.engine module¶

class retriever.lib.engine.Engine[source]¶

A generic database system. Specific database platforms will inherit from this class.

Attributes

db  
script  
table  

Methods

add_to_table(data_source)[source]¶

This function adds data to a table from one or more lines specified in engine.table.source.

auto_create_table(table, url=None, filename=None, pk=None)[source]¶

Creates a table automatically by analyzing a data source and predicting column names, data types, delimiter, etc.

auto_get_datatypes(pk, source, columns, column_values)[source]¶

Determines data types for each column.

convert_data_type(datatype)[source]¶

Converts Retriever generic data types to database platform specific data types

create_db()[source]¶

Creates a new database based on settings supplied in Database object engine.db

create_db_statement()[source]¶

Returns a SQL statement to create a database.

create_raw_data_dir()[source]¶

Checks to see if the archive directory exists and creates it if necessary.

create_table()[source]¶

Creates a new database table based on settings supplied in Table object engine.table.

create_table_statement()[source]¶

Returns a SQL statement to create a table.

cursor¶

Gets the db cursor.

download_file(url, filename, clean_line_endings=True)[source]¶

Downloads a file to the raw data directory.

download_files_from_archive(url, filenames, filetype='zip', keep_in_dir=False, archivename=None)[source]¶

Downloads files from an archive into the raw data directory.

drop_statement(objecttype, objectname)[source]¶

Returns a drop table or database SQL statement.

final_cleanup()[source]¶

Close the database connection.

format_data_dir()[source]¶

Returns the correctly formatted raw data directory location.

format_filename(filename)[source]¶

Returns the full path of a file in the archive directory.

format_insert_value(value, datatype)[source]¶

Formats a value for an insert statement, for example by surrounding it in single quotes.

get_connection()[source]¶

This method should be overloaded by specific implementations of Engine.

get_cursor()[source]¶

Gets the db cursor.

get_input()[source]¶

Manually get user input for connection information when script is run from terminal.

insert_data_from_archive(url, filenames)[source]¶

Insert data from files located in an online archive. This function extracts the file, inserts the data, and deletes the file if raw data archiving is not set.

insert_data_from_file(filename)[source]¶

The default function to insert data from a file. This function simply inserts the data row by row. Database platforms with support for inserting bulk data from files can override this function.

insert_data_from_url(url)[source]¶

Insert data from a web resource, such as a text file.

insert_statement(values)[source]¶

Returns a SQL statement to insert a set of values.

table_exists(dbname, tablename)[source]¶

This can be overridden to return True if a table exists. It returns False by default.

table_name(name=None, dbname=None)[source]¶

Returns the full tablename.

retriever.lib.engine.file_exists(path)[source]¶

Returns true if a file exists and its size is greater than 0.

retriever.lib.engine.gen_from_source(source)[source]¶

Returns a generator from a source tuple. Source tuples are of the form (callable, args) where callable(*args) returns either a generator or another source tuple. This allows indefinite regeneration of data sources.

retriever.lib.engine.skip_rows(rows, source)[source]¶

Skip over the header lines by reading them before processing.

retriever.lib.repository module¶

Checks the repository for updates.

class retriever.lib.repository.InitThread(group=None, target=None, name=None, args=(), kwargs=None, verbose=None)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

This thread performs all of the necessary updates while the splash screen is shown.

  1. Check master/version.txt to get the latest version (Windows only).
  2. Prompt for update if necessary (Windows only).
  3. Download latest versions of scripts from current branch.

Attributes

Methods

retriever.lib.repository.check_for_updates(graphical=False)[source]¶

Check for updates to scripts and executable.

retriever.lib.repository.download_from_repository(filepath, newpath, repo='https://raw.github.com/weecology/retriever/master/')[source]¶

Downloads the latest version of a file from the repository.

retriever.lib.repository.more_recent(latest, current)[source]¶

Given two version number strings, returns True if the first is more recent.

auto_get_columns(header)[source]¶

Gets the column names from the header row

Identifies the column names from the header row. Replaces database keywords with alternatives. Replaces special characters and spaces.

retriever.lib.templates module¶

Class models for dataset scripts from various locations. Scripts should inherit from the most specific class available.

Bases: retriever.lib.templates.Script

Script template based on data files from Ecological Archives.

Bases: retriever.lib.templates.Script

Script template for non-tabular data that are only for download

class retriever.lib.templates.HtmlTableTemplate(name='', description='', shortname='', urls={}, tables={}, ref='', public=True, addendum=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: retriever.lib.templates.Script

Script template for parsing data in HTML tables

Methods

class retriever.lib.templates.Script(name='', description='', shortname='', urls={}, tables={}, ref='', public=True, addendum=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class represents a database toolkit script. Scripts should inherit from this class and execute their code in the download method.

Methods

retriever.lib.tools module¶

EcoData Retriever Tools

This module contains miscellaneous classes and functions used in Retriever scripts.

class retriever.lib.tools.ScriptTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

Automates the process of creating unit tests for Retriever scripts. Uses the Python unittest module.

Methods

default_test(script, tables, include_pk=False)[source]¶

The default unit test. Tests in ScriptTest classes can simply call this function with the appropriate paramaters. The “script” property should be an instance of Script, and tables is a list consisting of tuples in the following format:

(table name, MD5 sum, [order by statement])

strvalue(value, col_num)[source]¶

Returns a string representing the cleaned value from a SELECT statement, for use in tests.

Arguments: value – the value to be converted,

col_num – the column number of the value (starting from 0)

col_num is not used in this function, but may be useful when overriding this function

retriever.lib.tools.checkagainstfile(lines, filename)[source]¶

Checks a set of lines against a file, and prints all lines that don’t match.

retriever.lib.tools.choose_engine(opts, choice=True)[source]¶

Prompts the user to select a database engine

retriever.lib.tools.final_cleanup(engine)[source]¶

Perform final cleanup operations after all scripts have run.

retriever.lib.tools.get_default_connection()[source]¶

Gets the first (most recently used) stored connection from connections.config.

retriever.lib.tools.get_saved_connection(engine_name)[source]¶

Given the name of an engine, returns the stored connection for that engine from connections.config.

retriever.lib.tools.getmd5(lines)[source]¶

Get MD5 value of a set of lines.

retriever.lib.tools.reset_retriever(scope)[source]¶

Remove stored information on scripts, data, and connections

retriever.lib.tools.save_connection(engine_name, values_dict)[source]¶

Saves connection information for an engine in connections.config.

retriever.lib.warning module¶

Module contents¶

retriever.lib contains the core EcoData Retriever modules.
